title.narrative: 5.4 EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND DRR

description.narrative: Throughout 2013 â€“ 2017, UNICEF programmes and their counterparts and partners benefit from reliable, valid and complete information on needs, responses and gaps as per the Core Commitments for Children for disaster risk management, emergency preparedness and response performance., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: High quality research and evaluation provides evidence to influence policies, budgets, programmes and programme adjustments, in favour of the most disadvantaged children and women in Pakistan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Throughout 2013 ? 2017, UNICEF programmes and their counterparts and partners benefit from reliable, valid and complete informationon needs, responses and gaps as per the Core Commitments for Children for disaster risk management, emergency preparedness andresponse performance.

description.narrative: UNICEF Pakistan&39;s humanitarian programming was strengthened through results-based humanitarian planning, monitoring and reporting in line with the CCCs. UNICEF and partners made good progress in achieving planned results despite access challenges and significant funding gaps, mainly through strengthening government systems and leveraging resources for preparedness, response, and DRR initiatives. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017
